pci_instance_creation_name_rule: Must only contain numbers, letters, underscores, dashes, or dots.
pci_instance_creation_quantity_rule: Your current quota allows you to create up to {{ quota }} instance(s) of type {{ type }} for the {{ region }} region simultaneously. <Link>Check your quota.</Link>
pci_instance_creation_select_deployment_: OVHcloud provides a robust and adaptable infrastructure designed to meet a wide variety of use cases through deployment models that balance cost-effectiveness, redundancy, and fault tolerance. These different options allow users to choose the approach that best meets their requirements for resilience, availability, and performance.

1-AZ Region: These single-zone regions are optimal for workloads where cost optimization is a priority. They are well-suited for general needs such as storage, backup, or applications whose availability requirements do not necessitate multi-zone redundancy. They offer a good compromise between reliability, performance, and cost control.

3-AZ Region: This model is designed for critical applications requiring high availability and increased resilience. With data replication across three distinct availability zones, 3-AZ regions significantly reduce the risk of downtime, ensuring business continuity even in the event of incidents affecting one or more zones. This level of redundancy is particularly suited for demanding production environments. To find out more, click here.

Local Zones: These infrastructures are specifically designed to meet needs requiring ultra-low latency or strict geographical constraints. By placing resources close to end users, Local Zones are ideal for use cases such as edge computing, video gaming, content delivery, or solutions requiring local regulatory compliance.
pci_instance_creation_select_localizatio: OVHcloud offers its Public Cloud solution worldwide through our data centres located on several continents. It is therefore accessible in Europe, North America, and Asia-Pacific. Our goal: to expand the availability of our services to new geographical areas.
pci_instance_creation_flavor_unavailable: This model is not available in your selected region. You can still select it, but you will need to choose another region for this model.
Your quota does not allow you to choose this instance model. Please increase your quota.
pci_instance_creation_select_new_region_: This model ({{ flavor }}) is not available in your selected region. However, you can select it but you will need to choose another available region for this model.
pci_instance_creation_select_image_help_: The images available at this stage depend on the choices made in the previous steps, that is to say, the compatibility with the instance model and regional availability. For example, if you want to select a Windows operating system and there are no Windows distributions available, you need to modify your choices from the previous steps.
pci_instance_creation_select_image_life_: Lifecycle of a distribution at OVH
pci_instance_creation_select_image_distr: The use of an image is subject to the prior acceptance of the provider's End User License Agreement.
pci_instance_creation_select_flavor_help: OVHcloud offers a wide range of instances to meet your computing, memory, storage, and performance needs.
General Purpose instances - these instances provide a balance between computing power, memory and storage. They are suitable for a wide range of applications and workloads.
Compute Optimized instances - designed for compute-intensive workloads, such as data processing, modelling, simulation and rendering.
Memory Optimized instances - designed for memory-intensive applications, such as in-memory databases and data analytics. They have a high amount of RAM.
Storage Optimized instances - perfect for workloads requiring fast, high-capacity data storage, such as massive databases or streaming applications.
Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) instances - equipped with graphics processing units (GPUs), they are designed for tasks such as machine learning, 3D visualisation, modelling and simulation.
Discovery instances - specific instances for application development and testing with shared resources to limit costs.
pci_instance_creation_choose_availabilit: A default availability zone has been selected. You have the option to customise this choice.
pci_instance_creation_availabilityZone_h: In a cloud environment, the availability and resilience of services are essential to ensure operational continuity, even in the event of a failure of an availability zone (AZ).

As instances are zonal services, they are only deployed in a single availability zone. To ensure resilience, it is therefore up to the customer to manually distribute their instances across multiple zones.
pci_instance_creation_select_sshKey_desc: An SSH key is required to connect to your service.
pci_instance_creation_select_sshKey_help: Understanding and using an SSH key
An SSH key allows you to connect securely to your instance without using a password.

It relies on a key pair:
  • a public key, registered in your OVHcloud account,
  • a private key, stored on your computer and used to establish the connection.

Why use an SSH key?
  • Secure access to your instance (encrypted connection).
  • No password entry required for each connection.
  • Compatible with all Linux and macOS systems (and Windows via WSL or PuTTY).

How to proceed
  1. Create an SSH key pair on your local machine (if you don't have one yet).
  2. Add your public key in your OVHcloud client area. You can also directly add this public key from the instance creation.
  3. Select this key when deploying your instance.
  4. Once the instance is deployed, connect via SSH with the corresponding private key.
Refer to the complete guide to create and use an SSH key
pci_instance_creation_select_sshKey_miss: You do not have an SSH key. Therefore, you will not be able to connect to your server. Create a key to access your server.
pci_instance_creation_select_sshKey_add_: Accepted SSH keys are of type RSA, ECDSA, and ED25519. Your SSH key will be available across all OVHcloud regions and datacenters for your project.
Your SSH key will be created at the end of the setup process.
Thank you for choosing a different name, this one is already in use.
pci_instance_creation_network_private_ne: The authorities are part of a private network. Internet or SSH access requires a Floating IP, a Gateway or an SSH Proxy.
pci_instance_creation_image_available_on: This image is available on other models.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_new_wa: The creation of your private network will take place at the end of the configuration process. You can edit it.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_new_us: Using the same VLAN ID for multiple private networks requires careful management of private IPs. Using a non-overlapping DHCP allocation pool can be a way to manage this issue.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_new_vl: VLAN ID 0 is used by default on other products including those outside the Public Cloud environment. Private IPs must be managed carefully
pci_instance_creation_network_add_new_ci: Please enter a valid IP address
pci_instance_creation_network_add_new_vl: The VLAN ID must be between 0 and 4000. Please check the entered value before continuing.
pci_instance_creation_select_billing_cho: Pay as you go, based on actual usage time.
pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_des: This feature allows you to automatically back up your instance according to the schedule of your choice.
pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_hel: Set up the backup of your instance
Protect your data and ensure the continuity of your infrastructure with automated backup mechanisms.

Default automated backup

Each instance has a local automated backup, with two possible options: 7-day rotation or 14-day rotation. These backups allow you to quickly restore your environment in case of an incident.

Custom backup and advanced management

If you wish to set a custom rotation or schedule your backups according to your needs, use the Workflow Management section.

Create an automated backup of an instance

Replication to another data centre

To enhance the resilience of your data, you can enable replication of your backups to a remote data centre. This provides additional security and the ability to restore your instance in another region.
pci_instance_creation_backup_billing_lab: Each backup will be charged: {{ price }} $t(pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_price_unit)
pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_dis: The remote backup follows the same rotation as the local backup.
pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_hel:
Where to find your backups

All your backups are accessible from: The management interface of your instance, the Backup & Workflow Management section.

Consult the complete guide on backup management

pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_rot.predefined: A backup is performed every day between 10:00 PM and 6:00 AM (UTC) and the rotation maintains a history of the {{ numEntries }} most recent entries. When the new backup is complete, the oldest one is deleted.
pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_rot.custom: Choose your own scheduling (UNIX Cron format), the number of rotations, and the maximum executions you want.

pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.title: Assign public connectivity
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.description: Assigning a public IP address allows access to your instance from outside the OVHcloud network. The creation of the floating IP will take place at the end of the configuration.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.basic_ip_label: Basic Public IP (Linked to the instance) - {{ price }}
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.basic_ip_description: A basic public IP is an address that does not persist beyond the lifespan of the resource.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.basic_ip_warning: Activating the basic public IP is not compatible with a gateway.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.floating_ip_description: Reserving a floating IP address assigns the address to your project until you explicitly release it.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.floating_ip_warning: By selecting this option, we will assign you a gateway size {{ size }}.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.floating_ip_unavailable_LZ_tooltip: Floating IPs are not available in local zones.

pci_instance_creation_network_gateway_un: The Gateway is not available in localZones.
pci_instance_creation_network_gateway_al: A Gateway is already assigned to the selected private network.
pci_instance_creation_discovery_project_: To complete the creation of your resource, you need to activate your project.
pci_instance_creation_select_localizatio: Public outgoing network traffic for instances is included for all regions, except for the Asia-Pacific region. In these two regions, 1 TB/month of public outgoing traffic is included in each Public Cloud project. Beyond this quota, each additional GB of traffic is charged at â‚¬0.01. Public incoming network traffic is included in all cases, for all regions.
pci_instance_creation_network_full_priva:
This instance will not have public access to the Internet. You will not be able to connect to it or reach external services unless you use a bastion or add a gateway.

This improves security but limits connectivity. On your Windows instances, you need to manually activate the license to access all services.
